result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrea D. Healy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andrea D. Healy is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andrea D. Healy was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Andrea D. Healy was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court Sentence

Count 1
Wisconsin State Prison - 9 years
Initial Confinement - 5 years
Extended Supervision - 4 years

Count 3 - CC to Count 1
Wisconsin State Prison - 6 years

Extended Supervision - 3 years

Count 5 - CC to Count 1 and Count 3
Wisconsin State Prison - 3-1/2 years
Initial Confinment - 18 months
Extended Supervision - 2 years

15cf116

Wisconsin State Prison - 3 1/2 years
Initial Confinement - 18 months

Jail credit - 178 days if revoked



Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration but is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Adj. 5:00 p.m.

3:45 p.m. Defendant Andrea D. Healy in court, in custody, with attorney Richard John Shawl. Mary M Sowinski, ADA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15CF12, 15CF116, 17CF275. Shawl speaks to plea agreement in 17CF275.  Sentencing rescheduled for May 16, 2018 at 04:00 pm. Adj. 3:56 p.m.

1:56 p.m. Defendant Andrea D. Healy in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Defendant Andrea D. Healy in custody.  Mary M. Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf116, 15cf12, 17cf275. Sowinski/Shawl statement - requests adjournment to finalize agreement. Attorney Shawl requests matter be scheduled with co-defendant. Court declines and states these matters will be scheduled at separate time. Bail continued. Adj. 2:01 p.m.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for April 30, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

11:07 a.m. Defendant Andrea D. Healy in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 12cf196, 15cf12 and 15cf116. Court in receipt of Shawl's packet and review of documents. Sowinski in receipt of documentation. Shawl will present witness testimony. Court will proceed with witness testimony prior to arguments. Richard Nitschke statement. Suzanne Scheldrop statement. Deb Smith, Oneida County Social Services, called. Attorney Fugle present in Court - moves for Court order or Defendant's permission to discuss confidential matters by Smith. Court questions defendant - defendant would like confidential information disclosed. Deb Smith, Oneida County Social Services, statement. Sowinski statement on sentencing. Shawl statement on sentencing. Defendant statement on sentencing. Court reviews discharge summary. Shawl requests credit for time spent at Koinonia. Court grants 53 days credit for time spent at Koinonia. Sowinski/Shawl/Court to cash bond posted.
 Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence 

12cf196 - Fine of $389.50 including costs

15cf12
WHS/POP - 3 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Comply with any CHIPS orders
Continue treatment currently engaged in until treatment providers deems not necessary.
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.

15cf116
Jail - 90 days with Huber for all purposes. To commence on/before Friday, December 2, 2016 at 4:00 p.m. 
Jail credit - 61 days (including credit for time spent in Koinonia)
CC/DNA Surcharge

Court costs to be taken from cash bond posted in 15cf12 and balance to be refunded to poster. Bond in 12cf196 to be applied to fine and balance to be refunded to poster.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given. NADVI given.
Adj. 11:56 a.m.
Tri-County Women's Outreach

9:06 a.m. Defendant Andrea D. Healy in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Calling 12tr2422, 12tr2423, 15cf116, 12cf196, 15cf12. Sowinski states agreement. In 15cf116-State moves to dismiss Counts 1 and 2 - Granted; State moves to amend Count 4 to Misdemeanor Bail Jumping - Granted. In 12cf196 - State moves to amend Count 1 to an ordinance violation of reckless driving - Granted; State moves to dismiss Counts 2, 3 and 4 - Granted. In 15cf12 - State moves to dismiss Counts 2, 4, 6 and 7 - Granted. State moves to dismiss 12tr2422 and 12tr2423 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Shawl requests continuance for sentencing; had anticipated joint request for PSI - State has determined not necessary - Shawl would like additional time to prepare sentencing memorandum. Bail continued. Adj. 9:18 a.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2016 at 11:00 am.

1:45 p.m. Defendant Richard C. Nitschke in court with attorney Corey Mehlos.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Defendant Andrea D. Healy in court with attorney Richard Shawl. Calling 12tr2423, 12tr2422, 12cf196, 15cf12,15cf116, 15tr1959, 15tr1960, 15tr1958, 15tr1961, 15cf13, 15cf119, 15cf257, 15cf117, 15cf119, 14cm133. Sowinski statement to proceeding today- agreement reached on Andrea Healy's cases, Shawl will argue that OWI be amended to reckless driving, preliminary hearings will be held in 15cf117, 15cf119 and 15cf257, motion to reconsider forfeiture of bond filed by Mehlos. Shawl states not ready to proceed to plea/sentencing today, would like to argue amendment of OWI charge. 
In 12cf196 - Motion to amend OWI charge to reckless driving. Sowinski statement to motion and factors to meet requirements of Wis. Stat. 967.055. Court notes he has previously viewed lengthy recording of Trooper Detienne's traffic stop. Shawl statement to motion and factors to meet requirements of Wis. Stat. 967.055. Court statement. Court finds that amending OWI charge not contrary to public interest and is being made to facilitate resolution of pending criminal matters and will approve amendment if State so moves. 
Court asks Attorney Shawl if defense in position to enter plea today on all matters. Shawl states needs some time to review plea questionnaire. Sowinski states motion for bond forfeiture could be made and Attorney Shawl could review plea questionnaire with defendant. Shawl requests leave of Court to review plea questionnaire. State has no objections. Shawl statement - does not wish to participate in any of bond forfeiture cases. Recess only in State v. Healy 2:18 p.m. 
4:34 p.m. Recalling State v. Healy, 12tr2423, 12tr2422, 12cf196, 15cf12, 15cf116. Defendant Andrea Healy with Attorney Richard Shawl in court. Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea hearing scheduled for July 8, 2016 at 8:30 a.m. State v. Healy will be heard prior to State v. Nitschke. Bail continued. Adj. 4:36 p.m.

2:03 p.m. Calling 14cm133, 12tr2422 12tr2423, 15tr1958, 15tr1959, 15tr1960, 15tr1961, 15cf117, 15cf119, 12cf196, 15cf12, 15cf116, 15cf13, 15cf257. Defendant Richard C. Nitschke in court with attorney Corey Mehlos.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also present Defendant Andrea D. Healy in court with Attorney Richard Shawl. Court states that DA's office has not had time to properly prepare due to understaffing in DA's office-Attorneys Mehlos and Shawl have agreed to today's hearing to be status conferences. Amended Motion to Suppress filed - Mehlos needs to be heard. Shawl Motion to Confidential Informant's needs to be heard. Court questions attorneys re Motion to be addressed - Mehlos - Motion to dismiss Information filed on 5/29/15 in 15cf13, disclose ID of confidential informants in 15cf13. Several motions re bond forfeiture in 15cf13, 15cf117 and 15cf119. Shawl - no further motions pending on behalf of Healy except a bond forfeiture filed previously. Schiek anticipates one-half day; Shawl and Mehlos - agree one-half day hearing is necessary. Mehlos states he will be filing additional motions after these motions are heard. Motions to be heard on June 23, 2016 are those mentioned above. Any additional motions filed by counsel must be formally noticed for June 23, 2016. Bail continued. Adj. 2:15 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
to disclose confidential informant

8:50 a.m. Defendant Andrea D. Healy in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Jodie Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 12tr2422, 12tr2423, 12cf196, 15cf12, 15cf116 - Bednar statement to informal conversations as to resolution - requests pre-trial conference. Counsel presents Order for return of property in 15cf12 - Shawl statement to consolidation of cases - Mehlos requests time to review Order prior to signing by Judge. Shawl states that State's offer includes provision that no motions be filed prior to agreement - Shawl believes motion hearing and pre-trial conferences should be scheduled at same time. Mehlos in agreement. If agreement is reached prior to 01-08-2016 - counsel to notify Court.

03:49 pm - Defendant Andrea D. Healy in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Defendant Andrea D. Healy in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to modify bond.  Currently set at $10,000 cash with conditions.  Court/Michlig in receipt of Discharge Summary from Koinonia.  Shawl/Michlig statement to motion.  Court modifies bond from cash to sig bond.
If unable to post cash bond, may attend inpatient treatment at Koinonia, may not possess/purchase muriatic acid and/or pseudoephedrine

01:57 pm - Defendant Andrea D. Healy in court, via video,  with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Defendant Andrea D. Healy in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shawl states Heally to be released from Koinonia tomorrow - to return to jail as currently a $10,000 cash bond with conditions is set.  Shawl/Michlig statement to motion to modify bond.  Court will take motion to reduce cash bond under advisement and will not proceed until Discharge Summary is provided.  Regarding the No Contact Provision of bond modification motion - Court lifts the no contact provision with Richard Nitschke. Bail continued.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Shawl in receipt of Information, waives reading.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters not guilty pleas.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
